content.raw: Unless the topic window is maximized, the font is super tiny when you mouse over the scan to see angles and distances.
content.html: Unless the topic window is maximized, the font is super tiny when you mouse over the scan to see angles and distances.

content.raw: Are you planning to adjust the font sizes when the topic window is small?
content.html: Are you planning to adjust the font sizes when the topic window is small?

content.raw: Should I file a ticket regarding the font size in the laser scan window when mousing over to view angles and distances? It's still really small when the topic viewer window is small.
content.html: Should I file a ticket regarding the font size in the laser scan window when mousing over to view angles and distances? It's still really small when the topic viewer window is small.

content.raw:
A maximize button would be useful as well in that regard.

What I also noticed is that the laser visualizer shows an update rate of 40Hz (jumping down to ~37 occasionally) while ```rostopic hz /scan``` shows a constant rate of ~34.4Hz which makes me think whether the lower lidar topic update rate is a ros publish related issue or whether the visualizer plugin estimates the update rate incorrectly.
content.html:
A maximize button would be useful as well in that regard.

What I also noticed is that the laser visualizer shows an update rate of 40Hz (jumping down to ~37 occasionally) while rostopic hz /scan shows a constant rate of ~34.4Hz which makes me think whether the lower lidar topic update rate is a ros publish related issue or whether the visualizer plugin estimates the update rate incorrectly.

content.raw:
I'll look into a maximize button.

The Hz rate reported by Gazebo is the most accurate. The rostopic rate is the value after Gazebo has transmitted the data, the ROS plugin decodes the data, and then republishes the data.
content.html:
I'll look into a maximize button.

The Hz rate reported by Gazebo is the most accurate. The rostopic rate is the value after Gazebo has transmitted the data, the ROS plugin decodes the data, and then republishes the data.

content.raw: I'm able to maximize using Unity. Is this a window manager issue?
content.html: I'm able to maximize using Unity. Is this a window manager issue?

content.raw:
I think it is.
I just updated the pull request. A topic viewer now incorporates the standard close, minimize, and maximize buttons. There is also a mutex to protect the update function.
content.html: I think it is. I just updated the pull request. A topic viewer now incorporates the standard close, minimize, and maximize buttons. There is also a mutex to protect the update function.

content.raw: There was a nice bug in the transport library which allowed subscription callbacks to be issued before a subscription was fully removed. I've updated this pull request to fix this problem.
content.html: There was a nice bug in the transport library which allowed subscription callbacks to be issued before a subscription was fully removed. I've updated this pull request to fix this problem.

content.raw: Can you explain your test case a little more? What do you mean by cycling through the topic selector?
content.html: Can you explain your test case a little more? What do you mean by cycling through the topic selector?

content.raw:
I load an empty world `gdb gzserver` and `gdb gzclient`. Once they're both open, I Ctrl+T and select the ~/physics/contacts message. I switch from ~/physics/contacts to ~/factory back and forth a couple dozen times and gzclient will segfault. Without gdb it closes silently.

I can file a separate issue for this, but I figured you might be able to fix it more easily now while it's all fresh.
content.html:
I load an empty world gdb gzserver and gdb gzclient. Once they're both open, I Ctrl+T and select the ~/physics/contacts message. I switch from ~/physics/contacts to ~/factory back and forth a couple dozen times and gzclient will segfault. Without gdb it closes silently.

I can file a separate issue for this, but I figured you might be able to fix it more easily now while it's all fresh.

content.raw: My guess would be that TextView::SetTopic needs a boost::mutex::scoped_lock when it modifies the msgList variable. I'll try that in the morning when I get back.
content.html: My guess would be that TextView::SetTopic needs a boost::mutex::scoped_lock when it modifies the msgList variable. I'll try that in the morning when I get back.

content.raw: I update some mutexes (mutexi?), and ran it 3 times in a row switching topics over 100 times. Give it a shot.
content.html: I update some mutexes (mutexi?), and ran it 3 times in a row switching topics over 100 times. Give it a shot.

content.raw: Is it good enough to approve?
